name: Four Seasons Hotel Sydney

reviews.text: We had an amazing time at the Four Seasons Hotel Sydney - we were celebrating a 50th birthday and wedding anniversary. We were given a bottle of champagne and cake, which made it extra special.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were just amazing - they just could not do enough for us. Even down to when we went for our early morning walk, the Concierge could not do enough for us when we came back, ie a bottle of cold water each plus a face washer to cool ourselves down with.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and the view amazing of the harbour.
reviews.title: Home away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definately go back.
reviews.title: Amazing, nothing more to say

reviews.text: Great service by staff!
reviews.title: Great location to the city

reviews.text: The Four Seasons Sydney enjoys one of the best locations in the Circular Quay area. If you get a Harbour View room you will be treated to a wonderful panorama from your bedroom, encompassing the Rocks, The Harbour Bridge, The Opera House and The Cruise Terminal, with an array of cruise ships coming and going. In short, a birds-eye view of all the major attractions.
reviews.title: Good location, great view but 30 year old building, poor catering and pricey

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks and the view was the best thing about it. The other good parts were the efficiency of most of the staff, the Executive Club on level 32 - which was very useful and well worth paying the extra for - providing breakfast, snacks, drinks and Internet all for a good price.
reviews.title: Fantastic Four Seasons Sydney

reviews.text: Not so good is the fact that this hotel was built in 1982, so it’s an old building. Although doubtless refurbished several times, it has the feel of an older hotel, from the elevators to the corridors and many of the fixtures, it all feels a little dated and not quite up to the standard of architecture normally associated with this hotel brand. In some areas it doesn’t feel 5-star at all. My room looked quite dated, but was adequate. The ground floor lobby, bars and restaurants are probably the best decorated areas.
reviews.title: All about the view not the stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For me the low point of my stay was the catering at the hotel. While the Executive Club was good and the room service pretty fast and high quality, the two ground floor offerings, The Woods Restaurant and Grain Bar, both served totally inadequate food. The food in the Grain Bar was very limited and sold out of many things half way through the evening. They also didn’t stock several staples of any International Bar, such as Southern Comfort, for example, and the bar servers also had very limited ability to mix cocktails.
reviews.title: Wonderful views and mostly good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Woods focuses on smoked grilled meats, which were alright, but so many of the dishes were extremely esoteric combinations which frankly didn’t seem to work together at all. It was a symphony of weird fusions. That would be fair enough if there were an alternative restaurant, but there isn’t. No place to buy a simple steak dinner or a grilled fish. We had an extended period of rain for part of my stay and it was a major inconvenience to not have an in-house simple but quality restaurant in which to eat.
reviews.title: Value best in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Four Seasons, over New Year's. We had a great view of the harbour and opera house. The room is what you expect of a Four Seasons- very comfortable and terrific bathroom.
reviews.title: Opera House view unbelievable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was premiere for touring the Harbour, Opera House, Royal Botanical Gardens, and the Rocks area.
reviews.title: Going through a confusing stage

reviews.text: Conceirge was very helpful.
reviews.title: How dare you charge for WIFI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have used Four Seasons in Sydney for twenty years, right back to when it was The Regent. It remains a pretty decent hotel, but it seems to be going through a bit of an identity crisis. It cannot seem to decide whether it wants to be a first class business hotel, a vacation destination hotel or a cruise ship departure point.
reviews.title: Breathtaking view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for ten days and they wanted to charge more than 200 Aussie dollars for wi-fi access. This is crazy. As a result, my wife and I went to Starbucks every day for breakfast and free wi-fi. We would otherwise have used the hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent experience on two separate nights.
great place!!
reviews.text: The location could not be better. The views, gym, food, decor, and service were fantastic!

reviews.title: better options elsewhere ?
reviews.text: Stayed here on business and loved the city. Just a shame the hotel does not live up to the surroundings. A great location (near Circular Quay) and good public areas were let down by small rooms (with tiny twin beds) and indifferent service. Room facilities were also pretty basic for Four Seasons. The staff were friendly but there were too few of them, although the concierge was good. There must be better alternatives in this wonderful city.

reviews.title: Loved It
reviews.text: The Best Hotel you could stay in Sydney. Location is the best. The service is very good. The hotel is walking distance to almost every interesting place in Sydney. Unlike the other 5 star hotels. You want to stay in Sydney you Stay in this Hotel. I gave it a four because the rooms are small and not too many interesting T.V chan. like the states.

reviews.title: Best Location in Sydney
reviews.text: We spent a week, and were lucky to have a suite with view on Opera House et Harbour Bridge. The location is great, the view amazing, the service pretty good.. The food was amongst the best we ever had (including top London and Paris restaurants). What else could anyone ask for?

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.text: It may be difficult to choose between the differents treatments offered by the beauty salon... If you really trying to find a fault: maybe the TV are not as modern as one could hope... The decor is not exactly the one I would have chosen...

You can't beat the location of the hotel--it's really convenient. Comfortable beds in ridiculously small rooms. Considering this is an older hotel, the decor is acceptable. The concierge staff is the best thing about the hotel. They are consistently helpful and attends to you immediately, well, at least the male ones do.
reviews.title: Not up to the Four Seasons name

reviews.text: Cab drivers may still refer to this hotel as the Regent or mistake your destination as Four Points hence it's always good to say George St after you've said Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Great location for a first time visit.

reviews.text: A lot of tour groups--especially cruises--stay here and that places a lot of stress on the staff, which is reflected in the degree of cleaniness in my room (well, they could be old stains).
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION, Great Hotel
Moldy rooms
reviews.text: Horrible coffee. Breakfast buffet is average. Lunch is good.

I am concerned about the competence of the front desk staff though. They are poor in customer relations and executing their job responsibilities. I will spare the details here as they are too long to write. The management keeps promising better service the next time and despite repeated stays, I have to say that there is still much room for improvement.
reviews.title: Small rooms ... but who cares!
Money for mothing
reviews.text: Overpriced ordinary hotel. Room interior needs renovation. 25$ extra for wifi in 800$ room is unacceptable! Hotel trsnsfer from airport delayed meeting us. Location is nice. Harbour view ix good but nothing special in it. Expected much more from this hotel brand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our 10th wedding anniversary here. The bed was brilliant, the food excellent, staff friendly and our view over harbour and opera house to die for. Lovely room service set up on a table at the window and the food was worth every cent.
reviews.title: luxury, pampering, view to die for

reviews.text: Stayed at the 4 seasons recently whilst on a business trip to Sydney. The 4 seasons used be called The Regent some years ago and I stayed there when it was a Regent hotel. It was much better then, in my opinion it is no longer a top class hotel, rather more a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: Nothing special just another 4 star hotel

reviews.text: There is really nothing to set aside the 4 seasons from any other similar hotel in Sydney, they're are all very much the same. The rooms are getting tired and in need of an upgrade and the food is nothing special.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay. Nothing was too much trouble.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a average stay, good but not bad either.
reviews.title: Short stay before cruise

reviews.text: We stayed there in late Sep for our honeymoon. We actually stayed there for a two week period as we were staying in Sydney for the entire time.
reviews.title: Honeymoon stay, enjoyable, great location.
Not as charming as The Observatory, but better location and view
reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location, we got the train from the Airport and when we exited the station there was our hotel which was a delight after our long travel time.

Check in was great and we were upgraded to a Harbour view room (after reviewing Trip Advisor before we knew what we stood a good chance to get upgraded from a city room). We got food delivered to the room that night and the waiter setup a table beside the window. It was a prefect view of the harbour and a great introduction to Sydney.
reviews.title: Well worthy the money

reviews.text: The room itself is very small and for a five star hotel they do need to address this.
reviews.title: A great location - average hotel

reviews.text: They also should have a complimentary business center so that guests can access email for free. The roomrate should cover this cost. We ended up going to a Kinkos near the QVB to access our email.
reviews.title: This Hotel Saved Our Trip!

reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights over the New Year period. Rooms was very nice and clean with soft towels in the bathroom and plenty of toiletries. Did,nt eat in any of the restauants so can't comment on the food.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Pool was great, heated. Could of done with more loungers though. Service was excellent throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Excellent Excellent

reviews.text: Location was great very close to the Quay and bridge great for New Year Eve.
reviews.title: Girls weekend

reviews.text: We've been lucky enough to stay at the Four Seasons on several ocassions. Each visit provides excellent service, friendly staff and unbelievable position to access Circular Quay, The Rocks and the City.
reviews.title: Fantastic location but average hotel!
Fantastic Sydney location!
reviews.text: Even the City View Rooms are worth a try.

description: Stunningly situated overlooking Sydney Harbour in the historic Rocks district, a short walk from the city's shopping and business centres, Four Seasons is vibrant and elegant, with dramatic harbourfront views and a luxurious day spa featuring exclusive skincare and aromatherapy treatments.
